title: 'Seriously y'all. Stop it': FDA tweets in response to false ivermectin claims
description: As coronavirus cases and hospitalizations soar, misinformation is persuading some people to grasp for unproven treatments. CNN's Pamela Brown reports this includes an anti-parasitic medicine for horses and cows.

title: Voting Rights Act being 'slowly choked to death,' warns labor icon Cesar Chavez's grandson
description: If Cesar Chavez were alive today, he'd be fighting for Latino voters but also African Americans and Asian Americans and members of the LGBTQ community -- anyone marginalized by efforts to curb voting rights and access to the polls, the labor hero's grandson says.

title: Opinion: Why Biden's views on Kabul terror attack make no sense
description: President Joe Biden has instigated a crisis in Afghanistan that could leave American citizens, as well as many Afghans who helped the United States, trapped there -- tarnishing the Biden administration and potentially recalling the Iranian hostage stand-off that dramatically weakened the presidency of Jimmy Carter.

title: Acosta: Kabul was a moment for national unity. And yet ...
description: In the wake of suicide attacks that killed American service members in Afghanistan, CNN's Jim Acosta says now is the time for "national unity," not for leaders to try and score political points.

title: Target of retaliatory strike was thought to be linked to potential future attacks at Kabul airport, US official says
description: The ISIS-K planner targeted by a US drone strike in Afghanistan was believed to be "associated with potential future attacks at the airport," a US defense official told CNN Saturday.

title: Donald Trump's recounting of his 2020 conversation with a Taliban leader is something else
description: Donald Trump called into conservative talk radio host Hugh Hewitt's show on Thursday, spending almost 45 minutes doling out his usual mix of braggadocio, blame-gaming and just plain old riffing.

title: Two Afghan athletes arrive from Kabul to Tokyo, International Paralympic Committee confirms
description: Two Afghan athletes have arrived in the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Village, following their safe evacuation from Afghanistan last weekend, the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) confirmed in a statement on Saturday.

title: Drone strike killed two 'high profile' ISIS targets, US says
US states brace for fierce destruction from Hurricane Ida
description: After slamming Cuba twice in fewer than 24 hours, Hurricane Ida is expected to pummel Louisiana on Sunday, urging evacuations in New Orleans and the surrounding coastal region.

title: Green hydrogen could be the fuel of the future. Here's why it's not yet a silver bullet
description: As the climate crisis escalates, the world is banking on carbon-free energy to achieve a future with zero greenhouse gas emissions, or a net-zero future, where we remove just as much greenhouse gas from the atmosphere as we emit.

title: DNA of ancient teen girl holds unknown human secrets
Manchester City smashes Arsenal 5-0 as Gunners drop to bottom of Premier League
description: Manchester City put on a stunning display to thrash Arsenal 5-0 at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday, dropping the Gunners to the bottom of the Premier League table with their third consecutive loss.

title: Freighter sinks after hitting Greek islets
description: A Togo-flagged cargo ship sank on Saturday after hitting Greek islets in the Aegean Sea but all 16 crew were rescued, the Greek coast guard said.

title: US strikes back at ISIS-K for Kabul attack that killed nearly 200
description: The US military carried out an airstrike against what it said was an ISIS-K planner in Afghanistan's eastern Nangarhar province, amid warnings of possible further terror attacks targeting the last-ditch US evacuation effort from Kabul.

title: Nandi Bushell, 11-year-old drummer, finally joins Foo Fighters on stage
description: She's the girl who dared to challenge Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl to an "epic" online drum duel -- and won.

title: 'There is no room to put these bodies,' Alabama health official says as Covid-19 deaths climb
description: The rate of Covid-19 deaths has increased in 42 US states in the last week, according to new data, as the spread of the more virulent coronavirus Delta variant has upended a spring of reopenings and led to increasing concern headed into autumn.

title: How a 'ragtag group' helped evacuate the Afghanistan national women's football team from the country
description: Time was of the essence following the rapid and chilling Taliban takeover of their country.

title: A teacher with a lesson in positivity for all of us
description: The fourth-graders walk up to a full-length mirror -- one after the other --  at a school in southwest Atlanta.

title: Watch Clarissa Ward's chilling interview with ISIS-K leader
description: The terror group ISIS-K has claimed responsibility for the deadly bombing attack outside Kabul airport which killed 13 US troops and more than 90 Afghans. CNN chief international correspondent Clarissa Ward speaks with an ISIS-K leader who claims to have had up to 600 men under his command.

title: Will political fallout of Afghan define Biden Presidency?
description: After the Kabul suicide bombing, several Republican lawmakers are calling for Biden's resignation. But, 'While there certainly will be a short-term hit,' says Ron Brownstein, CNN Senior Political Analyst, the long-term impact on his record may not be so harmful.

title: What is ISIS-K, the group that claimed the Kabul attack?
description: Graeme Wood warns that ISIS-K, the terrorist group that claimed responsibility for the Kabul airport suicide bombing, seeks 'global reach' and that the situation in Afghanistan is going to be 'as bad as it ever was.'

title: Why America is obsessed with the 'Jeopardy!' fiasco
description: A substantial slice of the nation's attention has been diverted (riveted, really) to the drama in the offices — and on the stage — of the game show "Jeopardy!"

title: Naomi Osaka says there's things she 'did wrong' during her 2021 French Open withdrawal
description: Four-time grand slam champion Naomi Osaka says "there's a lot of things" she "did wrong" during her 2021 French Open withdrawal.

title: A bust of Marsha P. Johnson went up near the Stonewall Inn as a tribute to the transgender activist
description: Visitors to New York's Christopher Park this week were greeted by the bust of Marsha P. Johnson, stoic yet softly smiling. She's wearing a tiara on her head, designed to loop live flowers through. It evokes a famous photograph of Johnson, beaming with a crown of brilliant blooms strewn through her hair.

title: Greenland expedition discover 'world's northernmost island'
description: Scientists last month set foot on a tiny island off the coast of Greenland which they say is the world's northernmost point of land and was revealed by shifting pack ice.

title: Meet the 16-year-old supplying Premier League stars with rare sneakers
description: Teenager Leon Gissing would wait among the crowds of fans outside Chelsea's Stamford Bridge stadium in the hope of meeting one of the team's players.

title: The 'billion-dollar air route' is bouncing back
description: Since March 2020, would-be travelers have experienced more turbulence on the ground than in the air. As always, though, CNN Travel are your attendants on hand to guide you through the safety instructions and point our your nearest exits.

title: Why older people are so much more vaccinated than younger people
description: Vaccination rates in America vary widely between blue and red states, between urban and rural populations and between those with college degrees and those without.

title: RFK assassin Sirhan Sirhan gets parole on 16th attempt
description: Sirhan Sirhan, the man convicted of assassinating Sen. Robert F. Kennedy in 1968, was granted parole Friday. State prosecutors did not object to his release. The 77-year-old spent 53 years in prison.

title: New Zealand is one of the last countries sticking to a zero Covid strategy
description: When New Zealand went into lockdown last week over a single Delta case, critics were quick to mock the country's risk-averse approach.

title: Hear Fareed Zakaria's prediction of what's to come in Afghanistan
description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria explains how the rivalry between the Taliban and ISIS-K could lead to the beginning of another Afghan civil war.
